stories.text:
Hi HN ! I would like to build a shell syntax parser and I would like to do it without yacc or tools like that, for learning purposes. I have been reading a lot parsing tutorials and I got a tokenizer working. From what I have read I now either have to make a parse tree or an abstract syntax tree out of my tokens with the help of a grammar from this page.
Now can you point me to any good documentation on how to make a tree out of it ?
All the tutorials I could find on the matter are made for arithmetic syntax and somehow I haven't been able to adapt those to my use case.
stories.title: What is the best way to parse shell-like syntax without a lexer?
A superyacht is a terrible asset

Perspectives on the Future of the Human Interface (2012)

stories.text:
I have had this idea for a while, for months but I never actually implemented it. It seemed kinda dangerous. It's called "Would you do it for a dollar?"

In simple terms: people can visit your profile and ask you" would you do ______ for a dollar?" Then you fulfill the request and earn $1. You need to reach payout limit before being paid out.

Seems very unusual and interesting, but I feel like it will be abused so much, especially by requesting dangerous things.

I started building some very simple MVP and registered a domain. I might release it and see where it goes. If you want to subscribe it would be great https://wouldyoudoitforadollar.com/
stories.title: I have this stupid idea called “Would you do it for a dollar?”
